articles.description: Tangles of toxic proteins are associated with various dementias, such as Alzheimer's disease. Often, these tangles are misfolded proteins. Now, researchers have identified a new mechanism that might reverse the build-up of these aggregates.
articles.content: Proteins are not static structures, they move and fold. In different shapes, they sometimes have different functions. And sometimes, when they misfold, they cause certain diseases, such as Creutzfeld… [+7189 chars]
